info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 13 at 1:57PM EDT until July 13 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF COLLETON AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES... At 156 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Canadys, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: Saint George, Colleton, Reevesville, Smoaks, Williams, Ruffin, Padgetts and Canadys. This warning includes I-95 in South Carolina between mile markers 64 and 85. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
